intro: Azalea semibarbata, commonly known as the Chinese azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to China and Korea. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features lance-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Azalea semibarbata blooms in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
